element.name: Final Patient Acuity
element.definition: The acuity of the patient's condition after EMS care.
element.v3Comment:
Definitions related to "Critical, Emergent, and Lower Acuity" can be found in the National EMS Core Content document from NHTSA EMS (DOT HS 809-898 July 2005) at
http://www.nhtsa.gov/people/injury/ems/emscorecontent/images/EMSCoreContent.pdf

asserts.assert: Final Patient Acuity should be recorded when Incident/Patient Disposition is "... (With Transport)" or "Patient Treated, Transported by this EMS Unit".
When Final Patient Acuity has a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting), it should be empty.

When Final Patient Acuity is empty, it should have a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting, if allowed for the element) or a Pertinent Negative (if allowed for the element), or it should be omitted (if the element is optional).
